content:
I am a final year student at BITS Pilani, Goa where I’m majoring in Math and Electronics. I work in the field of Cryptography. I am extremely interested in working on theoretical aspects of Cryptography and to address the gap between practices and theory in this field, especially in the areas of secure computation, zero-knowledge proofs and provable security of fundamental cryptographic primitives. Recently, I have gained interest in developing and analysing cryptographic approaches to come up with better privacy preserving techniques for data science, in particular Machine Learning.
I’m currently writing my senior thesis at Université catholique de Louvain supervised by Prof. Francois-Xavier Standaert. Recently, I interned with the Blockchain and Smart Contracts group at IBM Research, India under Dr. Dhinakaran Vinayagamurthy .
Feel free to check out my CV and drop me an e-mail if you want to chat with me!
summary: I am a final year student at BITS Pilani, Goa where I’m majoring in Math and Electronics. I work in the field of Cryptography. I am extremely interested in working on theoretical aspects of Cryptography and to address the gap between practices and theory in this field, especially in the areas of secure computation, zero-knowledge proofs and provable security of fundamental cryptographic primitives. Recently, I have gained interest in developing and analysing cryptographic approaches to come up with better privacy preserving techniques for data science, in particular Machine Learning.
title: Rahul B S

summary: Efficient implementations of interactive and non-interactive versions of Ligero-like protocols.
title: Zero Knowledge Proofs
10th Bar Ilan University Winter School on Cryptography
Secure Multi-Party Computation - Theory and Practice

summary: Inspecting quantum protocols which provide fully private assisted quantum computation.
title: Secure Assisted Universally Blind Quantum Computation

content:
• Working on coming up with efficient methods of biprimality testing for generation of shared RSA modulus.
• Also trying to improve efficiency of existing shared RSA-modulus generation methods such as Boneh Franklin’s test using tools in such as the average case error estimate method as in Damgard et al. for Miller Rabin test.
summary: Working on coming up with efficient methods of biprimality testing for generation of shared RSA modulus.
title: Efficient RSA shared key generation in a multi-party setting

summary: Implementation and analysis of ciphers GIMLI and PRESENT on FPGA and ARM Microcontroller
title: Efficient Hardware-based Symmetric Cryptographic Implementations

content:
• Cryptanalysis techniques on Beyond Birthday-Bound Secure claimed MAC schemes such as EWCDM, etc..
• Theoretically and practically analyzed the Encrypted Wegmen-Carter MAC scheme and H-coefficients technique.
summary: Theoretically and practically analyzed the Encrypted Wegmen-Carter MAC scheme and H-coefficients technique
title: Analysis of existing Beyond Birthday Bound MAC schemes

summary: Looking into how expander graphs can be used as Hash Functions
title: Random Graphs & applications in Cryptography
Summer School in Theoretical Computer Science

content:
• Programming Platform: C++, Tools Involved: NTL (ZZ class mainly), HELib (BGV-SHE scheme).
• Worked on integrating the HElib-MP Library to the HEAT API by analysing differences between HElib and HElib-MP
summary: Worked on integrating the HElib-MP Library to the HEAT API by analysing differences between HElib and HElib-MP.
title: Homomorphic Encryption Schemes
